com.shop.util.ccdb2
Class CCDB2Instance

java.lang.Object
  com.shop.util.ccdb2.CCDB2Instance

public class CCDB2Instance
extends java.lang.Object

Main API for CCDB2

Since:
1.1 JLZ 12/30/2008 - delete() wasn't closing the instance. This caused a resource leak (the background put thread).

Constructor Detail

CCDB2Instance

public CCDB2Instance(CCDB2Driver driver,
                     java.io.File directory,
                     java.lang.String baseFilename)
              throws java.io.IOException
Opens/Creates a CCDB2 instance. If the file already exists it's opened. If it doesn't exist it's created.

Parameters:
driver - driver instance
directory - Directory to create/read files
baseFilename - base file name for the files
Throws:
java.io.IOException - errors

CCDB2Instance

public CCDB2Instance(CCDB2Driver driver,
                     java.io.File directory,
                     java.lang.String baseFilename,
                     int pendingPutQueueLength)
              throws java.io.IOException
Opens/Creates a CCDB2 instance. If the file already exists it's opened. If it doesn't exist it's created.

Parameters:
driver - driver instance
directory - Directory to create/read files
baseFilename - base file name for the files
pendingPutQueueLength - length for the background put queue. If greater than 0, put writes will occur in a background thread but the queue will block if it gets longer than the specified length
Throws:
java.io.IOException - errors
Method Detail

loadFile

public void loadFile(java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger percentDone)
              throws java.io.IOException
Load the file. This should always be called - i.e. even if it's a new file.

Parameters:
percentDone - reporting mechanism. Will get updated with the percentage of the file that's loaded.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - errors

writeKeyData

public void writeKeyData(java.io.PrintStream out)
Writes index information to the given stream. The format is: [DB Path] -tab- [Key] -tab- [Address] -tab- [Object TTL] -newline-

Parameters:
out - stream to write to
